results.adx_keywords: Deaths (Obituaries);News and News Media;United States Politics and Government;Television;Shields, Mark;Public Broadcasting Service
results.title: Mark Shields, TV Pundit Known for His Sharp Wit, Dies at 85
results.abstract: A former campaign strategist, he became a fixture in American political journalism and punditry and was seen on “PBS NewsHour” for 33 years.

media.caption: The political commentator Mark Shields at his home in Chevy Chase, Md., in 2020. Politics had loomed large for him since he was a boy.
media.copyright: Valerie Plesch for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Palaces and Castles;Historic Buildings and Sites;Restoration and Renovation;Home Repairs and Improvements;Content Type: Personal Profile;Books and Literature;DePree, Hopwood;Middleton (England)
results.title: ‘Downton Shabby’: A Commoner Takes on an English Castle
results.abstract: A Los Angeles actor and producer moved across the pond to restore his crumbling ancestral home. But fixing up a 50,000-square-foot manor isn’t easy.

media.caption: “I first came to see the hall out of curiosity,” said Hopwood DePree, whose initial tour of his ancestral home, in 2013, included the morning room. He decided to stick around to bring the centuries-old property back to its early splendor.

results.byline: By Seth Berkman and Jenn Ackerman
results.title: Developers Embrace Passion for Pickleball
results.abstract: The growing sport has lured investors eager to cash in on its popularity, opening courts in former warehouses and vacant big-box stores, and adding food and other entertainment options.

results.title: The Battle Over Gender Therapy

results.title: Republican Drive to Tilt Courts Against Climate Action Reaches a Crucial Moment
results.abstract: A Supreme Court environmental case being decided this month is the product of a coordinated, multiyear strategy by Republican attorneys general and conservative allies.

media.caption: Republican attorneys want to hem in what they call the administrative state, the E.P.A. and other federal agencies that set rules and regulations that affect the American economy.

results.title: Biden Takes Tumble During Bike Ride in Delaware
results.abstract: The president did not need medical attention after he fell off his bike at a state park near his vacation home in Rehoboth Beach, according to the White House.

media.caption: President Biden after falling off his bike at Cape Henlopen State Park in Delaware. He and the first lady were spending the weekend at their vacation home in Rehoboth Beach.

results.title: This Is a Weirder Moment Than You Think

results.title: From a Childhood in News Choppers to the Anchor’s Seat
results.abstract: In her second memoir, “Rough Draft,” the journalist Katy Tur recounts growing up alongside her parents’ news-gathering exploits and her father’s outlandish, then violent, behavior.

media.caption: Tur in 2017. She writes: “My father is not Donald Trump and Donald Trump is not my father. But if anyone asked me, I’d recommend the same therapist.”
media.copyright: Sasha Arutyunova for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Jews and Judaism;Morocco;Spain
results.title: Saving Historic Songs, and a Jewish Culture in Morocco
results.abstract: For centuries after the expulsion from Spain, Morocco’s Sephardic Jewish women sang of love, loss and identity. Now, they’re almost all gone.

media.caption: A prayer songbook in Vanessa Paloma Elbaz’s office in Casablanca, Morocco.
media.copyright: Seif Kousmate for The New York Times

results.title: Emma Thompson and the Challenge of Baring All Onscreen at 63

results.adx_keywords: Content Type: Personal Profile;Sculpture;Clay;Native Americans;Ceramics and Pottery;Simpson, Rose B (1983- );Espanola (NM)
results.title: Rose B. Simpson Thinks in Clay
results.abstract: “Clay was the earth that grew our food, was the house we lived in, was the pottery we ate out of and prayed with,” says the Native American sculptor and rising star.

media.caption: Rose B. Simpson outside her adobe studio in Española, New Mexico. With what a curator describes as her “‘Mad Max,’ ‘Blade Runner’ vibe,” Simpson builds on — and rough up — pottery traditions from the Santa Clara Pueblo.
media.copyright: Minesh Bacrania for The New York Times
